facts.text: Orlando City Soccer Club is based in which city? (Orlando, Florida)
In which conference does Orlando City Soccer Club compete in Major League Soccer? (Eastern Conference)
Who owns Orlando City Soccer Club? (Zygi, Leonard, and Mark Wilf)
What is the name of Orlando City Soccer Club's home stadium? (Inter&Co Stadium)
In what year did Orlando City SC debut in Major League Soccer? (2015)
How many times did Orlando City win the USL Pro league championships before joining MLS? (Two times)
In what year did the Wilf family purchase Orlando City SC? (2021)
What significant trophy did Orlando City SC win in 2022? (U.S. Open Cup)
Who founded Orlando City SC? (Phil Rawlins)
From which club was Orlando City SC rebranded? (Austin Aztex FC)
Who scored the first goal in Orlando City's club history during their first preseason? (Lewis Neal)
What was the result of Orlando City's first competitive match in the USL Pro? (Lost 0-2 to Richmond Kickers)
Who scored the first competitive goal for Orlando City SC? (Maxwell Griffin)
What title did Orlando City SC win in their first USL Pro season? (USL Pro regular season title)
In what year did Orlando City SC win their first USL Pro championship? (2011)
On November 19, 2013, Orlando City was announced as the Major League Soccer's twenty-first franchise.
Orlando City's first player signed to an MLS contract was former Brazil international Kaká, who also became the team's first Designated Player.
Kaká was loaned to São Paulo until the start of the MLS season after signing with Orlando City.
Orlando City won its second USL Pro championship in 3 years by defeating the Charlotte Eagles 7-4 in the finals.
As an expansion team, Orlando City had the first overall pick in the 2015 MLS SuperDraft and used it to select Canadian forward Cyle Larin.
Orlando City's USL Pro license was acquired by minority owner Wayne Estopinal in June 2014, leading to the founding of Louisville City FC.
Head coach Adrian Heath signed a contract extension with Orlando City until the end of the 2017 MLS season on November 21, 2014.
Orlando City won its 3rd Commissioner's Cup in its last year in the USL Pro before joining MLS.
Orlando City hosted their first MLS game at the Citrus Bowl on March 8, 2015.
Kaká scored in stoppage time to earn Orlando City a 1–1 draw in their first MLS game against New York City FC.
Orlando City's first MLS victory came against Houston Dynamo with a score of 1–0.
In their inaugural MLS season, Orlando City finished 7th in the Eastern Conference and 14th in the overall standings.
Cyle Larin broke the MLS rookie scoring record with 17 goals in Orlando City's inaugural season.
Adrian Heath was fired as head coach of Orlando City in July 2016 and was replaced by Jason Kreis.
Orlando City moved to the Orlando City Stadium in 2017.
Dom Dwyer's trade to Orlando City in 2017 was a record trade between two MLS clubs at the time, totaling $1.6 million.
Kaká announced his retirement from Orlando City at the end of the 2017 season.
Josué Colmán was signed by Orlando City for a club record fee of reportedly $3 million in January 2018.
Cyle Larin was transferred to Beşiktaş for a club record fee of reportedly $2.3 million in January 2018.
Jason Kreis was released as head coach of Orlando City fifteen games into the 2018 season.
Orlando City set a new MLS record by conceding 74 goals in the 2018 season.
Yoshimar Yotún was transferred from Orlando City to Cruz Azul for a new club record fee of reportedly $4 million at the end of the 2018 season.
James O'Connor was fired at the end of the 2019 season with Orlando City missing out on playoffs and finishing 11th in the Eastern Conference.
Óscar Pareja was hired as head coach of Orlando City ahead of the 2020 season.
Orlando City reached the final of the MLS is Back Tournament in 2020 but lost to Portland Timbers 2–1.
Under Óscar Pareja's guidance, Orlando City ended a five-year playoff drought and reached the conference semi-finals in the 2020 season.
On July 21, 2021, Orlando City was officially sold to Zygi and Mark Wilf, owners of the Minnesota Vikings, for an estimated $400–450 million.
Daryl Dike was transferred from Orlando City to West Bromwich Albion for a club record fee of $9.5 million on January 1, 2022.
Facundo Torres was signed by Orlando City from Peñarol for a then club record fee of $9 million on January 24, 2022.
Orlando City won their first trophy as an MLS team by beating Sacramento Republic 3–0 in the 2022 U.S. Open Cup final on September 7, 2022.
Orlando City debuted in the CONCACAF Champions League in 2023, being eliminated in the round of 16 by Tigres UANL on the away goals rule after a 1–1 draw on aggregate.

Orlando City finished the regular season in second place overall and in the Eastern Conference with 63 points in 2023, the club's highest points total and highest placement in both the overall and Eastern Conference tables.
Orlando City qualified for the 2024 CONCACAF Champions Cup due to their placement in the 2023 MLS Supporters' Shield standings.
Orlando City defeated Canadian-side Cavalry FC 6–1 on aggregate in the first round of the 2024 CONCACAF Champions Cup.
Orlando City transferred Facundo Torres to Brazilian club Palmeiras for a new club record fee of up to $14 million on December 20.
The City of Orlando purchased downtown land for $8.2 million in April 2013 for the construction of a $110 million MLS soccer stadium.
The Florida House of Representatives failed to vote on a bill that would have provided up to $30 million in state funds towards the Orlando soccer stadium project in May 2013.
The sales tax rebate mechanism for the MLS team in Orlando was passed on April 25, 2014.
On August 8, 2013, Orange County Mayor Teresa Jacobs and Orlando Mayor Buddy Dyer reached an agreement to provide financial support for a new MLS soccer stadium in Orlando.
The Orange County Board of Commissioners approved the use of $20 million in tourist development tax funds for an $84 million multi-purpose soccer stadium on October 22, 2013.
Flávio Augusto da Silva announced on May 29, 2015, that the Orlando City soccer stadium would be privately funded and owned and operated by the club.
Orlando City hosted New York City FC in the stadium's inaugural match on March 5, 2017, with Cyle Larin scoring the first goal in a 1–0 victory.
In 2017, Exploria Stadium became the first venue to host MLS, NWSL, and USL teams in the same location.
The United States men's national team played their first match at the stadium on October 6, 2017, in a 2018 FIFA World Cup qualifier against Panama.
The stadium was renamed Exploria Stadium on June 4, 2019, after selling the naming rights to Exploria Resorts.
Atlético Madrid defeated the MLS All-Stars 3–0 in the 2019 MLS All-Star Game held at Exploria Stadium on July 31, 2019.
Inter&Co secured the naming rights to the stadium on January 18, 2024.
Orlando City played its games at the Florida Citrus Bowl Stadium, with an average attendance of over 6,900 fans per match during the 2012 season, the highest in the league at the time.
The team played the 2014 season at ESPN Wide World of Sports Complex due to Citrus Bowl refurbishments, with an average attendance of 4,657 people a game up to July 2014.
Orlando City's "fill the bowl" campaign in the opening home matches of the 2015 and 2016 seasons led to sell-out crowds of over 60,000.
Orlando City B is based at Osceola County Stadium and competes in MLS Next Pro.
Orlando City had an affiliation agreement with Louisville City FC after MLS dissolved its reserve league in 2014.
Orlando City ended their affiliation with Louisville City FC in 2016 and began its own USL expansion franchise, Orlando City B.
Orlando City B originally played at the Titan Soccer Complex.
Orlando City B became a founding member of USL League One in 2019.
Orlando City B finished in last place in USL League One in both seasons it contested before going on hiatus again.
In 2021, in OCB's absence, Orlando City resurrected their under-23 team to play in the United Premier Soccer League.
Orlando City B returned in 2022 for the inaugural MLS Next Pro season.
In 2010, Orlando City acquired a controlling interest in Central Florida Kraze and renamed them Orlando City U-23.
Orlando City U-23 won the PDL Championship in 2004.
After the 2011 season, Orlando City acquired controlling interest in the Florida Soccer Alliance youth soccer club, renaming it Orlando City Youth Soccer Club.
Orlando City Youth Soccer Club is a member of the Elite Club National League (ECNL).
On January 17, 2025, Orlando City and Orlando Pride partnered with the YMCA of Central Florida to begin a soccer program called The Lions Pride Jr. for children ages 3–14.
Orlando City's 20-acre training complex was officially opened on January 17, 2020.
The first logo of Orlando City was unveiled on December 16, 2010.
Orlando City adopted the nickname "Lions" from the defunct Orlando Lions team, which existed from 1985 to 1996.
The colors chosen for Orlando City were "Regal Red", "Pride Purple", and "Championship Gold".
Dixon Minear Design Marketing, the firm that created the branding for the Orlando Magic, also developed the branding for Orlando City.
Orlando City announced Orlando Health as their uniform sponsor at their home uniform unveiling.
The club's home uniform initially featured a white shirt with red shoulders and solid white shorts, while their away outfit consisted of a red shirt with white armpits and solid red shorts.

For their ascension to MLS, Orlando City unveiled a new logo that included a gold Lion face with 21 sun flares making up its mane within a purple shield, representing the club's position as the twenty-first team in MLS and Florida's nickname as The Sunshine State.
Orlando City's mascot is named Kingston, an anthropomorphized lion with brown and purple dreadlocks and purple war paint on his face.
Orlando Health became the first jersey partner in MLS history to commit to an expansion club before its admittance to the league in 2013.
Adidas signed on as Orlando City's kit provider for the 2015 season.
Orlando City sold over 13,000 season tickets before playing its first match in March 2015.
On March 8, 2015, Orlando City's home opener against New York City FC had an attendance of 62,510 people, a record for any expansion team.
Orlando City finished their first year with the second-highest average attendance figures in MLS, behind only Seattle Sounders.
The Ruckus and The Iron Lion Firm are the two major active supporters groups of Orlando City.
Orlando City and Inter Miami have an intrastate rivalry, but there is no official name for this series.
Orlando City played its first interstate match against an MLS opponent, Inter Miami, in its sixth season in 2020.
Orlando City and New York City FC made their MLS debut against each other, resulting in a 1–1 draw.
The 2020 MLS Cup playoffs match between Orlando City and New York City FC re-established Orlando's status as a rival in the eyes of New York City fans.
The founding ownership group of Orlando Pro Soccer was announced on March 4, 2010.
Phil Rawlins purchased the Orlando Pro Soccer USL rights in October 2010 and moved the Austin Aztex organization to Orlando.
Flavio Augusto da Silva became the majority owner of Orlando City after the club's successful expansion bid into Major League Soccer on February 17, 2013.
The sale of Orlando City, including the Orlando Pride and Exploria Stadium, to Zygi and Mark Wilf was officially completed on July 21, 2021, for an estimated value of $400–450 million.
Orlando City's technical partnerships include Sporting CP, Black Knight Football Club UK Limited, AFC Bournemouth, Auckland FC, Hibernian FC, and FC Lorient.
Major League Soccer granted an MLS franchise to Orlando City in 2013, with the original team founded in 2010.
Orlando City SC was named the 21st franchise of Major League Soccer, set for a 2015 debut.
Brazilian superstar Kaka joined Orlando City SC on July 1, 2014, after leaving AC Milan.
Orlando City SC and Benfica announced a strategic cooperation agreement on June 6, 2014.
Orlando City Soccer Club reinstated the fan group the Ruckus and announced a fan advisory council on July 21, 2014.
Orlando City SC's head coach as of 2020 is Óscar Pareja.
Orlando City SC's general manager is Luiz Muzzi.
The owners of Orlando City SC are Zygi, Leonard, and Mark Wilf.
Orlando City SC has had several head coaches including Heath (2015–2016), Murphy (interim in 2016 and 2018), Kreis (2016–2018), O'Connor (2018–2019), and Pareja (2020–present).
Orlando City SC plays its games at venues including Camping World Stadium, ESPN Wide World of Sports Complex, Inter&Co Stadium, and Osceola County Stadium.
Orlando City SC is associated with teams in other leagues and competitions, such as Orlando City B in MLS Next Pro and Orlando Pride in the NWSL.

Tampa Bay Mutiny, Miami Fusion, and Chivas USA are MLS teams that ceased operations, with their respective active years being 1996–2001 for Tampa Bay Mutiny and Miami Fusion, and 2005–2014 for Chivas USA.
The MLS Cup, Supporters' Shield, SuperDraft, and All-Star Game are notable events and awards in Major League Soccer.
Bethlehem Steel won the U.S. Open Cup the most times between 1915 and 1926, with victories in 1915, 1916, 1918, 1919, and 1926.
Fall River F.C. won the U.S. Open Cup three times consecutively from 1930 to 1932.
Stix, Baer and Fuller won the U.S. Open Cup three years in a row from 1933 to 1935.
New York Greek American Atlas won the U.S. Open Cup three consecutive times from 1967 to 1969.
No U.S. Open Cup was held in 2020 and 2021.
Orlando City SC's kit manufacturer changed from Lotto to Adidas starting in 2015.
Pedro Gallese, the goalkeeper for Orlando City SC, is from Peru.
Luis Muriel and Martín Ojeda, both forwards for Orlando City SC, are designated players (DPs) from Colombia and Argentina, respectively.

Orlando City SC has players from a diverse range of countries, including Peru, Brazil, Slovenia, Uruguay, Sweden, Argentina, Colombia, Venezuela, the USA, Iceland, Ghana, Japan, France, Croatia, and Chile.
In what year did Orlando City SC win their first U.S. Open Cup title?
How many times has Orlando City SC won the USL Pro title?
Who was the top goalscorer for Orlando City SC in the 2024 MLS season?
Facundo Torres
Which team did Orlando City SC defeat in the Round of 16 of the 2024 CONCACAF Champions Cup?
Tigres UANL
Who served as the head coach of Orlando City SC from October 25, 2010, to July 6, 2016?
Adrian Heath
Who was Orlando City SC's captain from 2019 to 2021?
Nani
What was Orlando City SC's average attendance during the 2023 MLS season?
Against which team did Orlando City SC record a 6-1 aggregate win in the 2024 CONCACAF Champions Cup Round one?
Cavalry FC
Who was Orlando City SC's head coach as of December 4, 2019?
Óscar Pareja
How many goals did Duncan McGuire score in the 2023 MLS season for Orlando City SC?
